title: 'Wallace & Gromit: Vengeance Most Fowl' Behind-the-Scenes Videos
description: "We problem-solve ahead by story-boarding." A series of behind-the-scenes videos have arrived online for Aardman's latest animated movie Wallace & Gromit: Vengeance Most Fowl. These promos are also a reminder that this delightful, nerdy, wacky comedy is now available on Netflix worldwide to watch anytime you want. It's a blast! The "world's best boss" ‚Äì Feathers McGraw ‚Äì is back with a vengeance. üêß A brand new epic Wallace & Gromit family adventure from Aaardman, this is the first full length W&G feature film in 19 years since BAFTA & Academy Award-winning The Curse of the Were-Rabbit. When Wallace invents a "smart gnome" it seems to develop a mind of its own and go haywire with evil A.I. programming. When it emerges that a vengeful figure from the past might be masterminding things, it falls to Gromit to battle the sinister forces. With the voices of Ben Whitehead (who gets his own video below), Peter Kay, Lauren Patel, Reece Shearsmith, Diane Morgan, Adjoa Andoh, Muzz Khan, and Lenny Henry. I always enjoy seeing making of video about stop-motion animation, it's impressive every time. Especially seeing how much work goes into hand-crafting literally every single part of the film - including [‚Ä¶]
author: Alex Billington
excerpt: "We problem-solve ahead by story-boarding." A series of behind-the-scenes videos have arrived online for Aardman's latest animated movie Wallace & Gromit: Vengeance Most Fowl. These promos are also a reminder that this delightful, nerdy, wacky comedy is now available on Netflix worldwide to watch anytime you want. It's a blast! The "world's best boss" ‚Äì
text: TRAILERS by January 3, 2025Source: YouTube "We problem-solve ahead by story-boarding." A series of behind-the-scenes videos have arrived online for Aardman's latest animated movie Wallace & Gromit: Vengeance Most Fowl. These promos are also a reminder that this delightful, nerdy, wacky comedy is now available on Netflix worldwide to watch anytime you want. It's a blast! The "world's best boss" ‚Äì Feathers McGraw ‚Äì is back with a vengeance. üêß A brand new epic Wallace & Gromit family adventure from Aaardman, this is the first full length W&G feature film in 19 years since BAFTA & Academy Award-winning The Curse of the Were-Rabbit. When Wallace invents a "smart gnome" it seems to develop a mind of its own and go haywire with evil A.I. programming. When it emerges that a vengeful figure from the past might be masterminding things, it falls to Gromit to battle the sinister forces. With the voices of Ben Whitehead (who gets his own video below), Peter Kay, Lauren Patel, Reece Shearsmith, Diane Morgan, Adjoa Andoh, Muzz Khan, and Lenny Henry. I always enjoy seeing making of video about stop-motion animation, it's impressive every time. Especially seeing how much work goes into hand-crafting literally every single part of the film - including even deciding where the camera goes, what the lighting & animation will look like for every last character, and everything else. Enjoy. Here's a few behind-the-scenes videos for Wallace & Gromit: Vengeance Most Fowl, from YouTube: You can watch the official trailer for Wallace & Gromit: Vengeance Most Fowl right here for more footage. Aardman's 4-time Academy Award-winning director Nick Park & Emmy-nominated Merlin Crossingham return with a brand new epic adventure: Vengeance Most Fowl. In this next Wallace & Gromit installment from Aardman, Gromit's concern that Wallace is becoming too dependent on his own inventions proves justified, when Wallace invents a ‚Äúsmart‚Äù gnome that seems to develop a mind of its own. When it emerges that a vengeful figure from the past might be masterminding things, it falls to Gromit to battle sinister forces and save his master... or Wallace may never be able to invent again! Wallace & Gromit: Vengeance Most Fowl is co-directed by animation filmmakers Nick Park (director of Wallace & Gromit: The Wrong Trousers, Chicken Run, Wallace & Gromit: The Curse of the Were-Rabbit, Early Man previously) & Merlin Crossingham ("Morph" series, Wallace & Gromit: The Big Fix Up video game). The screenplay is written by Mark Burton; from a story by Nick Park & Mark Burton. Produced by Richard Beek. Made by Aardman in Bristol, UK. This is premiering at AFI Fest in LA soon. Netflix will then debut Wallace & Gromit: Vengeance Most Fowl streaming on Netflix starting January 3rd, 2025 - it's now ready to view. Who's excited for it? Find more posts in: Animation, Featurette, To Watch, Trailer prev next
html:
TRAILERS

by
January 3, 2025
Source: YouTube

"We problem-solve ahead by story-boarding." A series of behind-the-scenes videos have arrived online for Aardman's latest animated movie Wallace & Gromit: Vengeance Most Fowl. These promos are also a reminder that this delightful, nerdy, wacky comedy is now available on Netflix worldwide to watch anytime you want. It's a blast! The "world's best boss" ‚Äì Feathers McGraw ‚Äì is back with a vengeance. üêß A brand new epic Wallace & Gromit family adventure from Aaardman, this is the first full length W&G feature film in 19 years since BAFTA & Academy Award-winning The Curse of the Were-Rabbit. When Wallace invents a "smart gnome" it seems to develop a mind of its own and go haywire with evil A.I. programming. When it emerges that a vengeful figure from the past might be masterminding things, it falls to Gromit to battle the sinister forces. With the voices of Ben Whitehead (who gets his own video below), Peter Kay, Lauren Patel, Reece Shearsmith, Diane Morgan, Adjoa Andoh, Muzz Khan, and Lenny Henry. I always enjoy seeing making of video about stop-motion animation, it's impressive every time. Especially seeing how much work goes into hand-crafting literally every single part of the film - including even deciding where the camera goes, what the lighting & animation will look like for every last character, and everything else. Enjoy.

Here's a few behind-the-scenes videos for Wallace & Gromit: Vengeance Most Fowl, from YouTube:

You can watch the official trailer for Wallace & Gromit: Vengeance Most Fowl right here for more footage.

Aardman's 4-time Academy Award-winning director Nick Park & Emmy-nominated Merlin Crossingham return with a brand new epic adventure: Vengeance Most Fowl. In this next Wallace & Gromit installment from Aardman, Gromit's concern that Wallace is becoming too dependent on his own inventions proves justified, when Wallace invents a ‚Äúsmart‚Äù gnome that seems to develop a mind of its own. When it emerges that a vengeful figure from the past might be masterminding things, it falls to Gromit to battle sinister forces and save his master... or Wallace may never be able to invent again! Wallace & Gromit: Vengeance Most Fowl is co-directed by animation filmmakers Nick Park (director of Wallace & Gromit: The Wrong Trousers, Chicken Run, Wallace & Gromit: The Curse of the Were-Rabbit, Early Man previously) & Merlin Crossingham ("Morph" series, Wallace & Gromit: The Big Fix Up video game). The screenplay is written by Mark Burton; from a story by Nick Park & Mark Burton. Produced by Richard Beek. Made by Aardman in Bristol, UK. This is premiering at AFI Fest in LA soon. Netflix will then debut Wallace & Gromit: Vengeance Most Fowl streaming on Netflix starting January 3rd, 2025 - it's now ready to view. Who's excited for it?

Find more posts in: Animation, Featurette, To Watch, Trailer
